<HR align=center width="100%" noshade SIZE=2>
<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>

<P align=justify><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Fellow Shareholders:</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Thanks to Kroger&#146;s
400,000 associates</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150; who strive
to provide friendly service and the freshest products to every customer, every
shopping trip &#150; </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>2014 was a
record-breaking year</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. </FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Our revenue reached
      $108.5 billion &#150; an all-time high;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Our stock price rose
      91%, making Kroger one of the top 10 performing stocks in the S&amp;P
      500;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Our positive
      identical store sales grew for an unprecedented 45 consecutive quarters;
      and <BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Our market share
      expanded for the 10<SUP>th</SUP> year
running.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>In short, 2014 was a
blockbuster year. We added nearly 25,000 new jobs, creating opportunity for our
current and future associates. And </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>we have confidence there is more growth and opportunity ahead
</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>for our company. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Since becoming CEO last
year, the two most common questions I hear from shareholders are </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>&#147;Why is Kroger doing so well?&#148;</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> and </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>&#147;Can you keep it up?&#148;</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> It
is my great honor to try and provide answers in this letter. </FONT></P>
<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;*</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Answering &#147;why is Kroger
doing so well?&#148; is like trying to answer &#147;what makes a meal great?&#148; </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>What makes a meal memorable
and enjoyable? It is the combination of food and drink, your companions and the
atmosphere, surprise and delight. It is not any one thing, but the
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>sum of its parts</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Like a great meal, there is
no single characteristic &#150; no one person or thing &#150; that makes Kroger great.
Rather, it is a </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>unique and
powerful combination of factors</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>
that helps explain Kroger&#146;s success. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>It all starts with our
friendly associates </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>executing
our</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> powerful Customer
1</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><SUP>st</SUP></FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>
Strategy</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, which we launched 12
years ago. We put the customer first in every decision we make. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Our store managers
successfully manage multi-million-dollar businesses. But first and foremost,
they are focused on our customers and associates. Our goal is to extend our
friendly hospitality to each one of the </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>eight million customers</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>
who shop in our stores daily. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Our merchandisers are
the best in the industry.</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> Their
depth of experience, combined with our world-class customer science and data
analytics, creates a powerful blend of art and science that is the hallmark of
Kroger&#146;s fresh and relevant merchandising. We are focused on bringing to each
customer what is most relevant to them &#150; to their tastes, budget and lifestyle &#150;
and delivering unique offers through personalized coupons, our popular fuel
rewards program, and exclusive digital offers.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Our </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>strong Corporate Brands portfolio</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> continues to gain market share, reaching its
highest level of penetration in seven years during the fourth quarter of 2014,
when it represented 28.2% of total units sold in our stores. These great
products, which can only be found in our family of stores, set us
apart.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We continue to invest in
price every year. Today, we are </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>saving our customers more than $3.5 billion annually</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> through every day lower prices. Our productivity
improvements fuel these price investments. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We continue to improve the
customer shopping experience. And, as I will outline below, we are
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>accelerating our entry into
eCommerce</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> through our recent
mergers with Harris Teeter and Vitacost.com, and by growing our digital
capabilities. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>It is the combination of
these strengths &#150; and many more not mentioned here &#150; that together delivered our
strong financial results in fiscal 2014. </FONT></P>
<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;*</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Fiscal 2014 Results &#150; An
Outstanding Year</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Kroger&#146;s consistently
remarkable performance delivered for shareholders in 2014. The growth plan we
first outlined in October 2012 includes four key performance measures: positive
identical supermarket sales growth, slightly expanding non-fuel FIFO operating
margin, growing return on invested capital and annual market share growth. In
2014, we met or exceeded each of these metrics. </FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=3>1</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade size="2">

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>At the end of the year, we:
</FONT></P>

<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Achieved an
      industry-leading 45<SUP>th</SUP> consecutive quarter of positive identical
      supermarket sales growth, without
    fuel;&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Exceeded our goal to
      slightly expand FIFO operating margin, without fuel and excluding
      adjustment items noted in our annual report, on a rolling four quarters
      basis;&nbsp;</FONT><BR>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Improved return on
      invested capital even as we increased capital investment;
      and</FONT><BR>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Captured incremental
      market share for the 10<SUP>th</SUP> consecutive year.
    </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>As a result,</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>we</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> exceeded our long-term,
net earnings per diluted share growth rate of 8-11% in fiscal
2014</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, and we</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> increased our dividend for the eighth consecutive
year</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. In fact,</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Kroger</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>has delivered double-digit compound growth in our
dividend since we reinstated it in 2006. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Net earnings for 2014
totaled $1.73 billion, or $3.44 per diluted share. Excluding adjustment items &#150;
the benefit of certain tax items and adjustments for pension plan agreements &#150;
Kroger&#146;s adjusted net earnings for 2014 totaled $1.77 billion, or $3.52 per
diluted share.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Our strong results during
2014 allowed us to make a </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>strategic and significant contribution to The Kroger Co.
Foundation</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. We use our foundation
dollars to support causes that our customers and associates consistently tell us
they care about, enhancing our reputation as a locally-connected retailer. We
are very proud that Forbes magazine previously recognized our work by naming us
the &#147;most generous company in America.&#148; This investment works to support the
communities that we serve.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; * </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Which brings us to the
second question: </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>&#147;Can you keep it
up?&#148;</FONT></I></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>My answer is an unequivocal
YES. Because, as I like to say, our &#147;to-do&#148; list is longer than our &#147;done&#148; list.
We are not done growing and differentiating. We are not done innovating to make
our customers&#146; lives better. And we are not done investing to grow for today and
the future. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Innovating to
Grow</FONT></I></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We are expanding our use
of technology.</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> In February 2014,
Kroger acquired You Technology, LLC, the Silicon Valley-based leader in digital
coupons and promotions. Several months later, our merger with Vitacost.com
accelerated our entry into the eCommerce space by several years. Vitacost
connects us to an amazingly talented team of associates who have created a
substantial platform that includes advanced technology and ship-to-home
fulfillment centers. We are currently testing Harris Teeter&#146;s successful
</FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>ExpressLane</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> concept &#150; an order online, pickup at the store
model &#150; in Cincinnati, and we plan to expand to other stores and markets in the
coming year. Together, the learnings from our Vitacost and Harris Teeter mergers
are helping us </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>give our customers
the ability to interact with us when, where and how they want</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. More customers than ever before are engaging
with our digital properties. More than 15 million customers have digital
accounts with Kroger, through which they receive unique benefits and offers on
our suite of digital platforms, including our mobile app, website and social
media sites. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We are entering a new
era in customer engagement with the introduction of 84.51&#176;. </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Early in 2015, Kroger and our data analytics
partner dunnhumby Ltd announced a new chapter in our relationship to accelerate
innovation in customer science. We replaced our existing exclusive joint venture
called dunnhumbyUSA with a more flexible arrangement and the acquisition of
certain assets from dunnhumbyUSA. Operating with those acquired assets as its
foundation, our new, wholly-owned subsidiary, 84.51&#176;, is starting with 500
talented associates from the former JV and the technology to continue developing
our leading customer loyalty program. In addition, the ability to combine what
we already know with other partners is exciting and will speed up innovation.
</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=3>2</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade size="2">

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We are quickly becoming a
top</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>destination for customers looking </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>for affordable, accessible organic and natural
foods</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. Natural Foods continues to
be the fastest-growing department in our stores on a percentage basis. Our
leading natural and organics store brand, </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Simple Truth</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, reached a
milestone $1.2 billion in annual sales in 2014. And this within two years of
launching the brand exclusively in our stores! During the year, more than 20
million households bought one of our more than 2,600 Simple Truth or Simple
Truth Organic items.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Investing to
Grow</FONT></I></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Our mergers with Harris
Teeter and Vitacost have also opened </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>new markets</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> that present
meaningful growth opportunities for Kroger. In fact, Vitacost today sells direct
to consumers in all U.S. states and territories, and more than 160 countries
worldwide. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We are currently pursuing
our </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>fill-in markets
strategy</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, as outlined in 2012,
and are making good progress. Fill-in markets are existing markets where we are
investing capital to grow square footage, primarily through new and expanded
stores and remodels, in order to increase our market share. </FONT></P>
<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; *</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>The Kroger
Difference</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Increasingly, shoppers care
about price, product selection and quality, the store experience </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>and</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>
how well companies take care of their associates, communities and the planet.
</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Taking Care of Our
Associates</FONT></I></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>I am proud to say that
Kroger is in the food business </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>and</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> the people
business.</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> Our people are our
greatest asset.</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We want our workforce to be
the healthiest in America. To improve workplace wellness, we give associates a
variety of tools, including an incentive program with measurable outcomes. Over
the last four years, we have seen a demonstrated improvement in the health of
our workforce through lower cholesterol, blood pressure and blood glucose
scores. And, our workplace well-being program received a &#145;Best Employers for
Healthy Lifestyles&#146; award from the </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>National Business Group on Health</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, and the company&#146;s commitment to employee health and wellness was
recognized by the </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>American Heart
Association</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Our goal is to provide our
associates a total compensation package that includes solid wages, good quality,
affordable health care, and retirement benefits. In 2014, Kroger invested $1.8
billion in our associates&#146; health care. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Kroger is also
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>one of the safest companies in our
industry</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. Associate engagement in
innovative safety programs has reduced accident rates in our stores and
manufacturing plants by 77 percent since 1995. In 2014, 649 retail locations and
three manufacturing plants went the entire year without a recordable
injury.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We continue to do our
part to create jobs and opportunity</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. We employ 25,000 more associates today than we did last year. More than
90 percent of these new jobs are in our supermarket divisions, ranging from
full-time department heads and assistant store managers to part-time courtesy
clerks and cashiers. Over the last seven years, Kroger has created more than
65,000 new jobs in our local communities. We are particularly proud that we
hired more than 6,000 veterans in 2014 and more than 29,000 veterans since 2009.
</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We pride ourselves on our
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>opportunity
culture</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, where all associates
have an opportunity to grow, build new skills and turn a job into a career. More
than two-thirds of our store managers started their Kroger careers as part-time
clerks. I began my own career at Kroger as a part-time stock clerk while earning
my degree at the University of Kentucky, so I know first-hand the opportunities
that are available to our associates. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>One of the things that
makes Kroger so special is how we extend our opportunity culture to everyone. We
have a long tradition of hiring people with disabilities, especially on our
front lines serving customers. Last year, Kroger was recognized by the
</FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Marriott Foundation for People
with Disabilities</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> and separately
by the</FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> Ohio Governor&#146;s Council on
People with Disabilities</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> for
significantly contributing to employment opportunities for the disability
community.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=3>3</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade size="2">

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=justify><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Taking Care of Our
Communities</FONT></I></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We are a locally-connected
retailer that is embedded in the community. When you combine the food and funds
we donate, working together our Company, foundation, customers, associates and
suppliers </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>contributed more than
$280 million to our local communities in 2014</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We strive to be connected
to and responsive to the local communities we serve by: </FONT></P>

<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Delivering the
      equivalent of </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>more than 270
      million meals</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> to more than
      100 local Feeding America food banks in
      2014.&nbsp;</FONT><BR>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Donating
      </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>more than $6 million in 2014
      in support of women&#146;s health and breast cancer awareness
      programs</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. Fully half of it
      was contributed by customers and
      associates.&nbsp;</FONT><BR>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Contributing
      </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>$3.3 million to the
      USO</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> in 2014 to help support
      the military and their families. Since 2010, Kroger has donated $11.9
      million to the USO &#150; the </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>largest cumulative gift to the USO</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> in that organization&#146;s
      history.&nbsp;</FONT><BR>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Supporting more than
      </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>30,000 schools and local
      organizations</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> with $51
      million donated in 2014 through our Community Rewards program that
      delivers customer-driven donations based on purchases in our
      stores.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We make all of these
strategic investments because they strengthen the communities we call home and
also improve our connection with our customers, who have identified these causes
as the priorities that are most important to them. We see our community
connection &#150; the Kroger difference &#150; as an important competitive advantage for
our company and as a point of pride for our associates. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We also see </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>engagement with local farmers and
producers</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> as part of our efforts
to make a difference in our communities. We work closely with growers to buy
local and market their seasonally-fresh products in our stores, and we
participate in established programs such as Colorado Proud, Kentucky Proud and
Go Texan to meet the growing demand for fresh, locally-sourced foods.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Kroger is a </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>leader in supplier diversity</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, spending more than $2 billion annually with
women- and minority-owned businesses. We proudly remain a member of the
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Billion Dollar
Roundtable</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> and the United States
Hispanic Chamber of Commerce </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Million Dollar Club</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>,
received a </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Top Organization for
Multicultural Business Opportunities</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> award from </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Diversity
Business</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, and was named one of
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>America&#146;s Top Corporations for
Women Business Enterprises </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>by the
</FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Women&#146;s Business Enterprise
National Council</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Taking Care of the
Planet</FONT></I></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>In 2014, we continued our
12-year journey to reduce our energy consumption while expanding square footage
and sales. </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We have reduced energy
consumption by 35% since 2000</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>.
Kroger was recently honored as a 2015 </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>ENERGY STAR Partner of the Year</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> for our work in energy management. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>One of Kroger&#146;s key
sustainability priorities is moving our retail stores and facilities toward
&#147;zero waste&#148;. Our stores are sending less waste to landfills and incinerators
through a variety of efforts, including composting and our innovative
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Perishable Donations
Program</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150; a process to rescue
safe, edible fresh products and donate them quickly to local food banks. This
system has been replicated by many retailers and today fresh products make up
more than half of the food distributed nationwide by Feeding America. Our
manufacturing facilities continue to lead waste reduction. Today,
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>26 of our 37 manufacturing plants
are designated as &#147;zero waste&#148; facilities</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Another important area is
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>sustainable
seafood</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. Our goal is to source
100% of our fresh and frozen seafood from sustainable sources. We continue to
make strong progress toward this goal, reaching 86% in 2014 and placing Kroger
among market-leaders. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>You can learn more about
our sustainability initiatives by reading our annual sustainability report,
available on our website sustainability.kroger.com.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; *</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=3>4</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade size="2">

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Retirements</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Dave Dillon, who as I said
in last year&#146;s letter has been called &#147;the grocers&#146; grocer&#148;, retired as Chairman
of the Board in December. We thank him for his ten incredible years as Chairman
and CEO, and wish him, his wife Dee, and his family much happiness as they turn
to the next chapter in their lives. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We also extend our
appreciation to Reuben Anderson, who retired from Kroger&#146;s Board of Directors in
2014 after 23 years of service; Steven Rogel, who retired from Kroger&#146;s Board of
Directors in 2014 after 15 years of service; Bruce Macaulay, president of
Kroger&#146;s Columbus division, who retired in March after 42 years of service with
the Company; and Katy Barclay, senior vice president of human resources, who
retires in the fall after five years developing Kroger&#146;s human resources
capabilities. On behalf of the entire Kroger family, we thank each of these
individuals for their service and leadership. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>It is my great honor to
continue working with one of the strongest management teams in the retail
industry. </FONT></P>
<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; *</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We are a company
inspired by purpose</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>: To lift up
our customers and each other, to make someone&#146;s day brighter, whether through a
smile, making dinner easier, or extending a hand to a friend. Our purpose
extends well beyond our store walls, and we strive to be good stewards for our
customers and associates, planet and communities.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>I am pleased to say we
fulfilled our commitments to our shareholders, customers and associates in 2014.
While we are proud of the strong year behind us, we are looking ahead. We intend
to continue growing market share and share of loyalty, and growing our top and
bottom lines. </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>There is much more
to come.</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>On behalf of our entire
team, thank you for your continued confidence in Kroger. </FONT></P><IMG src="kroger_def14a1x5x1.jpg" border=0><BR>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>W. Rodney
McMullen<BR></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Chairman and Chief
Executive Officer</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=3>5</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade size="2">

<P align=center><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareholders</FONT></B></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Thursday, June 25, 2015
<BR>11:00 a.m., eastern time</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To All Shareholders of The
Kroger Co.:</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>You are invited to the
Annual Meeting of Shareholders of The Kroger Co. which will be held at the Music
Hall Ballroom, Music Hall, 1241 Elm Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202, on June 25,
2015, at 11:00 a.m., eastern time, for the following purposes:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>1.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To elect
      eleven directors for the ensuing year;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>2.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To
      approve, on an advisory basis, our executive compensation;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>3.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>

      the selection of our independent auditor for fiscal year
2015;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>

    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>

      three shareholder proposals, if properly presented at the meeting;
      and</FONT></TD></TR>

    <TD vAlign=top></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>

    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To
      transact such other business as may properly be brought before the
      meeting.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Holders of common shares of
record at the close of business on April 30, 2015, will be entitled to notice of
and to vote at the meeting.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Attendance</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Only shareholders holding
shares at the close of business on the record date, or their duly appointed
proxies, may attend the meeting. </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>If you plan to attend the meeting, you must bring the notice of the
meeting that was separately mailed to you or the top portion of your proxy card,
either of which will serve as your admission ticket.</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>YOUR MANAGEMENT DESIRES TO
HAVE A LARGE NUMBER OF SHAREHOLDERS REPRESENTED AT THE MEETING, IN PERSON OR BY
PROXY. PLEASE VOTE YOUR PROXY ELECTRONICALLY VIA THE INTERNET OR BY TELEPHONE.
IF YOU HAVE ELECTED TO RECEIVE PRINTED MATERIALS, YOU MAY SIGN AND DATE THE
PROXY AND MAIL IT IN THE SELF-ADDRESSED ENVELOPE PROVIDED. NO POSTAGE IS
REQUIRED IF MAILED WITHIN THE UNITED STATES.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>If you are unable to attend
the annual meeting, you may listen to a live webcast of the meeting, which will
be accessible through our website, ir.kroger.com, at 11:00 a.m., eastern
time.</FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>May 13, 2015
<BR>Cincinnati, OH</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=3>7</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade size="2">

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P STYLE="text-align: center"><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Proxy Statement</FONT></B></P>
<P align=right><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>May 13, 2015</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>This Combined Notice, Proxy
Statement and Annual Report is being furnished to the shareholders of The Kroger
Co. in connection with the solicitation of proxies by the Board of Directors for
use at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held on June 25, 2015, at 11:00
a.m., eastern time, at the Music Hall Ballroom, Music Hall, 1241 Elm Street,
Cincinnati, Ohio 45202 and at any adjournments thereof.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Our principal executive
offices are located at 1014 Vine Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202-1100. Our
telephone number is 513-762-4000. This Proxy Statement and Annual Report, and
the accompanying proxy card were first furnished to shareholders on May 13,
2015.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Your proxy is being
solicited by the Board of Directors of The Kroger Co., and the cost of
solicitation will be borne by Kroger. Kroger will reimburse banks, brokers,
nominees, and other fiduciaries for postage and reasonable expenses incurred by
them in forwarding the proxy material to their principals. Kroger has retained
D.F. King &amp; Co., Inc., 48 Wall Street, New York, New York, to assist in the
solicitation of proxies and will pay that firm a fee estimated at present not to
exceed $15,000. Proxies may be solicited personally, by telephone,
electronically via the Internet, or by mail.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Robert D. Beyer, W. Rodney
McMullen, and Ronald L. Sargent, all of whom are Kroger directors, have been
named members of the Proxy Committee for the 2015 Annual Meeting.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>As of the close of business
on April 30, 2015, the record date, our outstanding voting securities consisted
of 490,201,501 common shares, the holders of which will be entitled to one vote
per share at the annual meeting. The shares represented by each proxy will be
voted in the manner specified unless the proxy is revoked before it is
exercised. You may change or revoke your proxy by giving us notice in writing
sent to Kroger&#146;s Secretary, or in person at the meeting, or by executing and
sending us a subsequent proxy. Shareholders may not cumulate votes in the
election of directors.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>If you are a registered
shareholder and return your proxy card without instructions, the Proxy Committee
will vote in accordance with the recommendations of the Board of Directors. If
you hold shares in street name and do not provide your broker with specific
voting instructions on proposals 1, 2, 4, 5 and 6, your broker does not have the
authority to vote on those proposals. This is generally referred to as a &#147;broker
non-vote.&#148; Proposal 3 is considered a routine matter and, therefore, your broker
may vote your shares according to your broker&#146;s discretion. The vote required,
including the effect of broker non-votes and abstentions for each of the matters
presented for shareholder vote, is set forth below.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Item No. 1, Election of
Directors</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150; An affirmative vote
of the majority of the total number of votes cast &#147;for&#148; or &#147;against&#148; a director
nominee is required for the election of a director in an uncontested election.
Accordingly, broker non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on this
proposal. A majority of votes cast means that the number of shares voted &#147;for&#148; a
director nominee must exceed the number of votes &#147;against&#148; such
director.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Item No. 2, Advisory
Vote to Approve Executive Compensation</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150; Advisory approval by shareholders of executive compensation requires
the affirmative vote of the majority of shares participating in the voting.
Accordingly, broker non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on this
proposal.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Item No. 3, Ratification
of Independent Auditors</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150;
Ratification by shareholders of the selection of independent public accountants
requires the affirmative vote of the majority of shares participating in the
voting. Accordingly, abstentions will have no effect on this
proposal.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Item Nos. 4, 5, and 6,
Shareholder Proposals </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>&#150; The
affirmative vote of the majority of shares participating in the voting on a
shareholder proposal is required for its adoption. Accordingly, broker non-votes
and abstentions will have no effect on these proposals. Proxies will be voted
AGAINST these proposals unless the Proxy Committee is otherwise instructed on a
proxy properly executed and returned.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=3>8</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade size="2">

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Important Notice
Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials for the Shareholder Meeting to be
Held on June 25, 2015.</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Under the rules adopted by
the SEC, we are furnishing proxy materials to our shareholders primarily on the
Internet. We believe that this process should expedite shareholders&#146; receipt of
proxy materials, lower the cost of our annual meeting and help to conserve
natural resources. On or about May 13, 2015, we mailed to each of our
shareholders (other than those who previously requested electronic or paper
delivery), a Notice of Availability of Proxy Materials containing instructions
on how to access and review the proxy materials on the Internet and instructions
on how to vote your shares. The Notice of Availability of Proxy Materials also
contains instructions on how to receive a paper or e-mail copy of the proxy
materials. If you receive a Notice of Availability of Proxy Materials, you will
not receive a printed copy of the proxy materials unless you request one. If you
receive paper copies of our proxy materials, you may also view these materials
at www.proxyvote.com. If you receive paper copies of our proxy materials and
wish to receive them by electronic delivery in the future, please request
electronic delivery at www.proxyvote.com.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=3>9</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade size="2">

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Proposals to Shareholders</FONT></B></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Election of Directors<BR></FONT></B><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>(Item no.
1)</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Kroger&#146;s Board of
Directors, as now authorized, consists of eleven members. All members are to be
elected at the annual meeting to serve until the annual meeting in 2016, or
until their successors have been elected by the shareholders or by the Board
pursuant to Kroger&#146;s Regulations, and qualified. Kroger&#146;s Articles of
Incorporation provide that the vote required for election of a director nominee
by the shareholders, except in a contested election or when cumulative voting is
in effect, will be the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast for or
against the election of a nominee.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>The experience,
qualifications, attributes, and skills that led the Corporate Governance
Committee and the Board to conclude that the following individuals should serve
as directors are set forth opposite each individual&#146;s name. The committee
memberships stated below are those in effect as of the date of this proxy
statement. It is intended that, except to the extent that authority is withheld,
proxies by the Proxy Committee will be voted for the election of the following
nominees:</FONT></P>

<P align=center><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Nominees for Director for Terms of Office
      <BR>Continuing Until 2016</FONT></B></P>

    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="15%">
      <P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Nora A.
      Aufreiter</FONT></B></P></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top align=center width="73%">
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Ms. Aufreiter is a
      Director Emeritus of McKinsey &amp; Company, a global management
      consulting firm. She retired in June 2014 after more than 30 years as a
      director and senior partner. During this time, she worked extensively in
      the U.S., Canada, and internationally with major retailers, financial
      institutions and other consumer facing companies. Before joining McKinsey,
      Ms. Aufreiter spent three years in financial services working in corporate
      finance and investment banking. She is a member of the Board of Directors
      of The Bank of Nova Scotia and Nieman Marcus Group. Ms. Aufreiter also
      serves on the boards of St. Michael&#146;s Hospital and the Canadian Opera
      Company, and is a member of the Dean&#146;s Advisory Board for the Ivey
      Business School in Ontario, Canada. She is a member of the Financial
      Policy Committee and the Public Responsibilities Committee.</FONT></P>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Ms. Aufreiter has
      over 30 years of broad business experience in a variety of retail sectors.
      She brings to Kroger&#146;s Board her expertise gained while earning her MBA
      from the Harvard Business School. Her vast experience in leading
      McKinsey&#146;s North American Retail Practice, North American Branding service
      line and the Consumer Digital and Omnichannel service line is of
      particular value to the Board.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>

      <P  align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Beyer is Chairman
      of Chaparal Investments LLC, a private investment firm and holding company
      that he founded in 2009. From 2005 to 2009, Mr. Beyer served as Chief
      Executive Officer of The TCW Group, Inc., a global investment management
      firm. From 2000 to 2005, he served as President and Chief Investment
      Officer of Trust Company of the West, the principal operating subsidiary
      of TCW. Mr. Beyer is a member of the Board of Directors of The Allstate
      Corporation and Leucadia National Corporation. He is chair of the
      Corporate Governance Committee, a member of the Financial Policy
      Committee, and our Lead Director.</FONT></P>
      <P  align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Beyer brings to
      Kroger his experience as CEO of TCW, a global investment management firm
      serving many of the largest institutional investors in the U.S. He has
      exceptional insight into Kroger&#146;s financial strategy, and his experience
      qualifies him to serve as a member of the Board. While at TCW, he also
      conceived and developed the firm&#146;s risk management infrastructure, an
      experience that is useful to Kroger&#146;s Board in performing its risk
      management oversight functions. His abilities and service as a director
      were recognized by his peers, who selected Mr. Beyer as an Outstanding
      Director in 2008 as part of the Outstanding Directors Program of the
      Financial Times. His strong insights into corporate governance form the
      foundation of his leadership role as Lead Director on the
    Board.</FONT></P></TD>

      retirement in January 2007. She joined Avon in 1970. Prior to her most
      recent assignment, Ms. Kropf had been Executive Vice President and Chief
      Operating Officer, Avon North America and Global Business Operations from
      1998 to 2000. From 1997 to 1998 she was President, Avon U.S. Ms. Kropf was
      a member of Avon&#146;s Board of Directors from 1998 to 2006. She currently is
      a member of the Board of Directors of Coach, Inc., MeadWestvaco
      Corporation, and Sherwin Williams Company. She is a member of the Audit
      and Financial Policy Committees.</FONT></P>

      extensive experience in manufacturing, marketing, supply chain operations,
      customer service, and product development, all of which assist her in her
      role as a member of Kroger&#146;s Board. Ms. Kropf has a strong financial
      background, and has served on compensation, audit, and corporate

      and Chief Executive Officer of First Service Networks from 2000 to 2014.

  <TR>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="15%"><STRONG><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">Susan M.
      Phillips</FONT></STRONG></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top align=center width="73%">
      <P  align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Dr.
      Phillips is Professor Emeritus of Finance at The George Washington
      University School of Business. She joined that university as a Professor
      and Dean in 1998. She retired as Dean of the School of Business in 2010
      and as Professor the following year. She was a member of the Board of
      Governors of the Federal Reserve System from December 1991 through June
      1998. Before her Federal Reserve appointment, Dr. Phillips served as Vice
      President for Finance and University Services and Professor of Finance in
      The College of Business Administration at the University of Iowa from 1987
      through 1991. She is a director of CBOE Holdings, Inc., State Farm Mutual
      Automobile Insurance Company, State Farm Life Insurance Company, State
      Farm Companies Foundation, National Futures Association, the Chicago Board
      Options Exchange, and Agnes Scott College. Dr. Phillips also was a trustee
      of the Financial Accounting Foundation until the end of 2010. She is a
      member of the Audit and Compensation Committees.</FONT></P>
      <P  align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Dr. Phillips brings
      to the Board strong financial acumen, along with a deep understanding of,
      and involvement with, the relationship between corporations and the
      government. Her experience in academia brings a unique and diverse
      viewpoint to the deliberations of the Board. Dr. Phillips has been
      designated an Audit Committee financial
expert.</FONT></P></TD>

    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="5%"><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">2003</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="15%"><STRONG><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">James A. Runde</FONT></STRONG></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="73%">
      <P  align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Runde is a special advisor and a former
      Vice Chairman of Morgan Stanley, a financial services provider, where he
      has been employed since 1974. He was a member of the Board of Directors of
      Burlington Resources Inc. prior to its acquisition by ConocoPhillips in
      2006. Mr. Runde serves as a Trustee Emeritus of Marquette University and
      the Pierpont Morgan Library. He is a member of the Compensation Committee
      and chair of the Financial Policy Committee.</FONT></P>
      <P  align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Runde brings to
      Kroger&#146;s Board a strong financial background, having led a major financial
      services provider. He has served on the compensation committee of a major
      corporation.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="4%"><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">68</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="5%"><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">2006</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">13</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

  <TR>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="15%"><STRONG><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">Ronald L.
      Sargent</FONT></STRONG></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top align=center width="73%">
      <P  align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr.
      Sargent is Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Staples, Inc., a
      consumer products retailer, where he has been employed since 1989. Prior
      to joining Staples, Mr. Sargent spent 10 years with Kroger in various
      positions. In addition to serving as a director of Staples, Mr. Sargent is
      a director of Five Below, Inc. During the past five years, he was a
      director of Mattel, Inc. and The Home Depot, Inc. Mr. Sargent is chair of
      the Audit Committee and a member of the Public Responsibilities
      Committee.</FONT></P>
      <P  align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Sargent has over
      35 years of retail experience, first with Kroger and then with increasing
      levels of responsibility and leadership at Staples, Inc. His efforts
      helped carve out a new market niche for the international retailer that he
      leads. His understanding of retail operations and consumer insights are of
      particular value to the Board. Mr. Sargent has been designated an Audit
      Committee financial expert.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="4%"><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">59</FONT></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #ffffff 10pt solid" vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="5%"><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">2006</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="15%"><STRONG><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">Bobby S.
Shackouls</FONT></STRONG></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="73%">
      <P  align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Until the merger of
      Burlington Resources Inc. and ConocoPhillips, which became effective in
      2006, Mr. Shackouls was Chairman of the Board of Burlington Resources
      Inc., a natural resources business, since July 1997 and its President and
      Chief Executive Officer since December 1995. He had been a director of
      that company since 1995 and President and Chief Executive Officer of
      Burlington Resources Oil and Gas Company (formerly known as Meridian Oil
      Inc.), a wholly-owned subsidiary of Burlington Resources, since 1994. Mr.
      Shackouls is a director of Plains GP Holdings, L.P. and Oasis Petroleum
      Inc. During the past five years, Mr. Shackouls was a director of
      ConocoPhillips and PNGS GP LLC, the general partner of PAA Natural Gas
      Storage, L.P. Mr. Shackouls is a member of the Audit and Corporate
      Governance Committees. Mr. Shackouls previously served as Kroger&#146;s Lead
      Director.</FONT></P>
      <P align=justify><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">Mr. Shackouls brings to the Board the
      critical thinking that comes with a chemical engineering background, as
      well as his experience leading a major natural resources company, coupled
      with his corporate governance expertise.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="4%"><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">64</FONT></TD>

      noted, each of the directors has been employed by his or her present
      employer (or a subsidiary) in an executive capacity for at least five
      years.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">14</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Information Concerning the Board of Directors</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Committees of the Board</FONT></B></P>
<P style="text-indent: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>The Board has five standing
committees including Audit, Compensation and Corporate Governance. All standing
committees are composed exclusively of independent directors. The current
charter of each Board committee is available on our website at ir.kroger.com
under Corporate Governance &#150; Committee Composition.</FONT></P>
<P style="text-indent: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>The table below provides
the current membership of our independent directors on each of the standing
Board committees.</FONT></P>
